meanings.sent1: She accidentally overchilled the soda in the fridge.
meanings.sent2: Don't overchill the ice cream; it will become too hard to scoop.
meanings.sent3: The overchilled water froze into a solid block in the freezer.
meanings.sent4: His icy stare seemed to overchill the room, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The overchilled wind cut through their jackets like sharp knives.

meanings.sent1: The overchill wind made her shiver uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The overchill temperature outside caused the pipes to freeze.
meanings.sent3: The overchill air-conditioning in the office made everyone bundle up in sweaters.
meanings.sent4: Her overchill response to the news shocked everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The overchill lake looked like a sheet of glass under the moonlight.
